derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from Middle Dutch boecweite 'beech wheat', its grains being shaped like beechmast

entry.def: Buckwheat is a type of small black grain used for feeding animals and making flour. Buckwheat also refers to the flour itself.

means.word_mean: 1. or member of genus Fagopyrum; annual Asian plant with clusters of small pinkish white flowers and small edible triangular seeds which are used whole or ground into flour
